===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|やかた}}

Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=やかた|屋|tr1=ya|t1=house, hut, structure|形|tr2=kata|t2=shape, form}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|やかた|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|屋形}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|やかた}}

# a [[roofed]] [[structure]] on a [[boat]], shaped like a [[house]]
# a [[house]]-shaped structure on a [[cart]], such as a [[caravan]]
# a [[temporary]] [[house]], a temporary [[shelter]]
# a [[mansion]], a [[manor]] [[house]], an [[estate]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=やかた|honorific|archaic}} a form of address or reference for a [[noble]]
# {{short for|lang=ja|sort=やかた|屋形船|nodot=1}} (''yakata-bune''): a [[houseboat]]

=====Synonyms=====
{{der-top|Synonyms}}
* {{sense|structure on a boat}} {{ja-r|船%屋%形|ふね%や%かた}}
* {{sense|temporary house}} {{ja-r|仮%屋|かり%や}}, {{ja-r|寓%居|ぐう%きょ}}
* {{sense|mansion, manor}} {{ja-r|邸%宅|てい%たく}}, {{lang|ja|館}} (''tate'', ''tachi'' - see above)
* {{sense|honorific}} {{lang|ja|館}} (''tate'', ''tachi'' - see above)
* {{sense|houseboat}} {{ja-r|屋%形船|や%かた-ぶね}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|たて}}

Likely derived as the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} ''tate'' of verb {{m|ja|建てる|tr=tateru||to erect a structure}}, in turn from the verb {{m|ja|立つ|tr=tatsu||to stand, to stand up}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

The reading ''tate'' is most common in eastern Japan, correlating to the ''tachi'' reading in western Japan.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|たて|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|たて}}

# a large [[building]]
# a [[mansion]], a [[villa]], an [[estate]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=たて|honorific|archaic}} a form of address or reference for a [[noble]]
# a small [[castle]] or [[fort]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|たち}}

Likely derived as the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} ''tachi'' of verb {{m|ja|立つ|tr=tatsu||to stand, to stand up}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>  Alternatively, may be a shift in pronunciation from ''tate'' above.

The reading ''tachi'' is most common in western Japan, correlating to the ''tate'' reading in eastern Japan.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|たち}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|たち}}

# a large [[building]]
# a [[mansion]], a [[villa]], an [[estate]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=たち|honorific|archaic}} a form of address or reference for a [[noble]]
# a small [[castle]] or [[fort]]

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かん}}

{{IPAchar|/kwan/}} → {{IPAchar|/kan/}}

{{bor|ja|ltc|sort=かん|館|tr={{IPAchar|/kuɑn<sup>H</sup>/}}||house; lodge; residence; premises}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|かん|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かん|hhira=くわん}}

# a large [[building]]
# a [[mansion]], a [[villa]], an [[estate]]
# a [[movie]] [[theatre]]

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|かん|hhira=くわん}}

# a [[hall]], a [[building]], a section of a building, a [[house]]

{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|むろつみ}}

Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=むろつみ|室|tr1=muro|t1=cellar; room|積み|tr2=tsumi|t2=piling up, heaping up, stacking up|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|積む}} ''tsumu'', “to pile, heap, or stack up”}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> possibly in reference to the way that the oldest such buildings may have started out as simple [[pithouse]]s.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|むろつみ}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|室積}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|むろつみ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=むろつみ|rare|archaic}} [[lodging]]s along a [[stagecoach]] [[route]], an [[inn]]
